main event: While on Flight 125 from Keflavik, Iceland to Argentina, the crew encountered an unidentified circular object emitting a yellow-orange light on 10 February 1951.
interesting points: The object approached the aircraft and grew very bright and large with a semi-circular shape,The sighting lasted for 7-8 minutes,The object made a sudden 180-degree turn and disappeared over the horizon at high speed,Multiple crew members witnessed the object, and one suggested it could be an aurora display, but the conclusion reached was that it was astronomical in nature.
sighted object: a glowing circular object with a yellow-orange ring
witness description: crew members of Flight 125, including pilots and navigators from the U.S. Navy
